file_content.text: Yjal's done with you.
Here's where my arms dealer buddy hangs out. Follow my lead.
Hey, flunky. Where's Yjal?
I'll let him know you're here.
Kaliyo Djannis, as I live and breathe. I didn't expect to find you at my shop.
No one else has what you've got.
So very true. Tell me--have you brought my money, so I can quit paying my thugs to harass you?
Don't forget your manners.
Introduce us, Kaliyo.
Yjal, this is my new partner.
My sympathies to you, stranger.
Yjal and I met when he was selling vibroround hard ammo to Iridonian mercs. Spotted each other's markings across the room.
We started... working together. Then it soured.
The way I heard it, you were stalking her for her charms--not her credits.
She said you were in love.
That's not exactly how I put it.
She is lovely and... dextrous, but I'm better off without her. As might you be.
Kaliyo decided, after nearly a year of supplying me with product, to play a little shell game. I lost a considerable sum and nearly went to prison.
I told you to put trackers on those cannons.
I'm a businessman and I like her, so I'll call off my dogs if she recoups my losses. Otherwise... I can't leave her so pretty.
I don't respond well to extortion.
We're not paying anything.
You're doing better than me.
I understand your position.
What'll it take for me to end this?
How much do you want?
You serious?
I'll put together an invoice.
...there. Pay the bill, and I'll never bother your friend again.
If you really wanted Kaliyo dead, you wouldn't be dragging this out.
You're better than this, Yjal.
Fair point, but what I want isn't always what I get.
I've got the money. Here.
Fine. I'll pay you off.
You're sure you want to spend it on her? I could sell you a custom disruptor rifle for two-thirds the price....
I think she made her choice.
I think he made his choice.
Of course. A pleasure doing business, and a pleasure seeing you again, Kaliyo.
You ever get back to Talofan, call me.
I can't believe you spent all that.
If no one needs to die, there's no point in killing.
I prefer to avoid a fight.
For a woman like you, no price is too high.
[Flirt] You're worth it.
So, what, you wouldn't kill for me? You can talk your way out of this later.
There are always more credits in the galaxy.
It's only money.
Yeah... I guess. We can talk about it later.
You should've told me what he really wanted.
I can't believe you lied.
Like it mattered. Look, we can talk about it later.
For now, we've got two more targets to go.
For now, we've got three more targets to go.
For now, we've just got one target left.
For now, we should get out of here.
Any chance you can come down from there?
I don't have NUMBER credits.
I'm afraid not. All prices are as listed, and I don't have time to negotiate.
Good try.
I had to know your asking price.
I was just curious. [Attack]
You don't see me paying it.
How would you like to run your business while on the Empire's blacklist?
I can make your life horrible.
It doesn't appeal. On the other hand, I've done deals with powerful people in my time. I'm sure some would look the other way.
Kill them both, please.
You shouldn't have caused her trouble.
We brought a quick death.
Sorry, Yjal. Don't have the cash.
I will have you both killed.
The boss isn't in. Come back later, might have some new weapons.
I work security here--I don't work for Yjal. I don't want trouble.
